episodeTitle: The Guy Who's the Closest to Invincible? And the Most Dangerous Man!
episodeTitleJapanese: 最も無敵に近い奴？と最も危険な男！
episodeTitleRomanized: Mottomo muteki ni chikai yatsu? To mottomo kiken na otoko!
description: After being trapped by Foxy's Noro Noro Beam, Luffy and Nami work together to defeat the Foxy Pirates one final time. Following their victory, the Straw Hats land on a mysterious island for a barbecue, but their peace is interrupted when they venture into the jungle and encounter a sleeping stranger. To Robin's shock and terror, the mysterious man is revealed to be Admiral Aokiji, one of the Navy's three most powerful warriors.

events.title: Straw Hats Trapped by Foxy's Noro Noro Beam
events.description: Foxy uses his Noro Noro Beam to slow down the Straw Hat Pirates and drop them into a deep pit on the deck of the Sexy Foxy ship. The crew finds themselves outmaneuvered by Foxy's deceptive tactics once again.
events.significance: Sets up the final confrontation between the Straw Hats and Foxy Pirates, demonstrating Foxy's cunning nature.

events.title: Nami's Thunderstorm Tempo Debut
events.description: Nami uses her Clima-Tact to conjure a powerful thunderstorm cloud, neutralizing Foxy's fiery boxing gloves and driveable punching tanks. This advanced weather manipulation technique demonstrates Nami's growth as a combatant.
events.significance: First appearance of Thunderstorm Tempo, showcasing Nami's evolution in combat and her ability to counter diverse threats.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami unleashes her new weather technique to counter Foxy's attacks

events.title: Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Koma Debut
events.description: Luffy unveils the Gomu Gomu no Koma (Gum-Gum Spinning Top) technique, spinning his body rapidly like a top to attack Foxy's forces. This creative application of his Devil Fruit powers helps turn the tide of battle.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's continuous innovation with his rubber abilities and his adaptability in combat.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy debuts his spinning top technique against Foxy

events.title: Foxy's Kani Kani Punch
events.description: Foxy attempts to use his Kani Kani Punch (Crab Crab Punch) technique against the Straw Hats, showcasing another of his combat abilities during the final confrontation.
events.significance: Reveals another technique in Foxy's arsenal, though it proves ineffective against Luffy and Nami's teamwork.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Foxy
events.description: Through combined efforts with Nami, Luffy decisively defeats Foxy, ending the prolonged conflict with the Foxy Pirates. Despite his defeat, Foxy's crew remains loyal to him.
events.significance: Concludes the Foxy's Return arc and demonstrates the power of teamwork between Straw Hat crew members.

events.title: Foxy Pirates Accept Their Captain
events.description: After his defeat, Foxy tearfully asks his crew if they will still accept him. The Foxy Pirates enthusiastically confirm their loyalty, showing the bond between captain and crew despite Foxy's repeated failures.
events.significance: Demonstrates themes of loyalty and camaraderie, showing that a crew's bond isn't solely based on strength or success.

events.title: Straw Hats Land on Mysterious Island
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates disembark on a new island and decide to have a barbecue on the beach. Sanji begins preparing food as the crew relaxes after their encounter with Foxy.
events.significance: Transitions from the Foxy's Return arc to the upcoming Long Ring Long Land/Admiral Aokiji encounter arc.

events.title: Foxy's Crab Submarine Attack
events.description: Foxy, Porche, and Hamburg attack the Straw Hats in a large crab-shaped submarine. They believe it will be mistaken for an ordinary crab, and their prediction proves correct when Luffy tries to grab it for the barbecue.
events.significance: Shows Foxy's persistence despite repeated defeats, adding comic relief while demonstrating his never-give-up attitude.

events.title: Luffy Destroys Foxy's Submarine
events.description: When the crab submarine pilots try to shake Luffy off, he becomes angry and slams the submarine into the beach, causing it to explode. This marks the final defeat of Foxy in this arc.
events.significance: Definitively ends the Foxy Pirates subplot, allowing the story to transition to the more serious Aokiji encounter.

events.title: Zoro and Sanji's Argument About Nami
events.description: Zoro and Sanji engage in their typical bickering, with Zoro accusing Sanji of pushing Nami down the stairs. Sanji retorts that he saved her life, showcasing their rivalry and contrasting personalities.
events.significance: Maintains character consistency and provides comic relief before the serious encounter with Aokiji.

quotes.text: You pushed her down the stairs!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro criticizing Sanji's treatment of Nami

quotes.text: I saved her life, you idiot!
quotes.speaker: Sanji

events.title: Discovery of Bicycle Tracks in Jungle
events.description: The Straw Hats venture into the island's jungle to search for medicinal herbs and are confused by bicycle tracks running through the jungle path. This unusual sight puzzles the crew.
events.significance: Foreshadows Aokiji's presence on the island and his unique mode of transportation, building tension before his reveal.

events.title: Admiral Aokiji's First Appearance
events.description: Following the bicycle tracks to a clearing, the Straw Hats discover what appears to be a mushroom growing from a rock. When Chopper investigates, he disturbs a mysterious man sleeping behind the rock. The stranger is revealed to be Admiral Aokiji (Kuzan), one of the Navy's three Admirals.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most important characters in One Piece - Admiral Aokiji. This marks the first time the Straw Hats encounter a Marine Admiral, representing a massive power gap and threat level. Aokiji's introduction sets up major future story developments.

events.title: Robin's Terrified Reaction to Aokiji
events.description: Upon seeing Aokiji, Nico Robin displays an unprecedented level of fear and panic, shocking the crew who have never seen her react this way. Robin's terror suggests a significant and dangerous history between her and the Admiral.
events.significance: Reveals that Robin has a past connection with Aokiji that terrifies her, foreshadowing major revelations about Robin's backstory and the Ohara incident. This moment raises the stakes and tension dramatically.

events.title: Introduction of Marine Admiral's Power Level
events.description: Robin explains to the crew that Aokiji is one of the Navy Headquarters' three Admirals - the most powerful weapon in the World Government's arsenal. She emphasizes that Admirals represent the highest tier of Marine strength.
events.significance: Establishes the power hierarchy of the One Piece world and introduces the concept of Marine Admirals as nearly invincible forces. This revelation creates enormous tension and fear for the Straw Hats' safety.

events.title: Aokiji Recognizes Robin
events.description: Aokiji responds to seeing Robin by saying that she's grown into a beautiful woman, indicating that he has known her since she was a child. This confirms a long history between them and deepens the mystery of their connection.
events.significance: Confirms that Aokiji and Robin have a shared past, likely connected to the Ohara incident and Robin's childhood. This sets up crucial backstory revelations and adds layers to both characters.

quotes.text: You've grown into a beautiful woman.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji's first words to Robin, revealing their past connection

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami unleashes her new weather technique

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy debuts his spinning top technique

quotes.text: You pushed her down the stairs!
quotes.speaker: Zoro

quotes.text: I saved her life, you idiot!
quotes.speaker: Sanji

quotes.text: You've grown into a beautiful woman.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji recognizing Robin from her past

themes.description: The episode explores crew loyalty through the Foxy Pirates' unwavering acceptance of their captain despite repeated defeats, contrasting with the Straw Hats' own deep bonds.
themes.symbolism: Foxy's crew accepting him back represents unconditional loyalty regardless of strength or success.

themes.description: Robin's unprecedented terror at seeing Aokiji reveals that even the strongest individuals carry traumatic memories from their past that can paralyze them with fear.
themes.symbolism: Robin's fear represents the inescapable nature of one's past and the long shadow cast by childhood trauma.

themes.description: The introduction of Admiral Aokiji establishes the vast power difference between the Straw Hats and the World Government's elite forces, emphasizing how far the crew still has to grow.
themes.symbolism: Aokiji sleeping peacefully represents the confidence of absolute power - he has no fear of pirates.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates significant growth as a fighter, debuting the Thunderstorm Tempo and working strategically with Luffy to defeat Foxy.
keyActions: Uses Thunderstorm Tempo to neutralize Foxy's attacks
Works in tandem with Luffy to defeat the Foxy Pirates

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy continues to innovate with his Devil Fruit abilities and maintains his carefree attitude even when facing an Admiral.
keyActions: Debuts Gomu Gomu no Koma technique

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's terrified reaction to Aokiji reveals a traumatic past connection and shows vulnerability rarely seen in her character.
keyActions: Displays unprecedented fear upon seeing Aokiji
Explains to the crew that Aokiji is a Marine Admiral
Reveals her past connection with Aokiji

characterSpotlights.development: Aokiji is introduced as a mysterious and powerful figure with a past connection to Robin, establishing him as a major threat and important character.
keyActions: First appearance sleeping in the jungle
Establishes his status as a Marine Admiral
quotes: You've grown into a beautiful woman.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Foxy's Return arc (episodes 225-228) is anime-original filler. The manga goes directly from the Davy Back Fight to the encounter with Aokiji without Foxy returning.
Aokiji's first appearance in the manga occurs on Long Ring Long Land after the Davy Back Fight, without the Foxy's Return subplot.

trivia.fact: Episode 226 aired on March 20, 2005 in Japan, nearly 7 months after the conclusion of the original Davy Back Fight arc.
The HDTV version of this episode contains several animation errors, including Zoro appearing in two locations simultaneously and inconsistencies in Nami's weather attack sequence.
Aokiji's voice actor Takehito Koyasu is famous for voicing many antagonistic characters in anime, most notably Dio Brando from JoJo's Bizarre Adventure.
The Foxy's Return arc is generally considered one of the least popular filler arcs in One Piece, with this episode having an IMDb rating of 6.5/10, lower than the series average.

This episode marks a significant tonal shift from comedic filler content to serious canon material, with Aokiji's introduction being one of the most important moments in the pre-Enies Lobby storyline.
